Having seen this on the storefront for a reduced price, I was undecided on Dreadhalls. So I watched a few Youtube videos and kind of wish I hadn't - I think I would have enjoyed this game even more had I not spoiled things for myself. But still, I decided to download it.

So... Dreadhalls. A game involving (mostly) randomly generated labyrinths. The goal? Collect eyeballs and find the exit. I didn't see how it could be that scary and OHMYGODAGIANTDOGTHINGISCHASINGME!

Yes, Dreadhalls is reliant on a few scares. They're not jump scares as such, but scares in the sense that you're walking too quickly, turn a corner, and bump into something.

The labyrinths are very detailed graphically, and extremely claustrophobic. It's this sense of enclosure that makes me feel uncomfortable when I play. Second only to Condemned: Criminal Origins, this game is probably the scariest I have ever played. I had to frequently take off the headset to collect myself, before diving back in for some masochistic torture.

Different monsters appear within the mazes, and your only shot is to outrun them - they cannot be killed. There aren't a huge number, but it's enough to make you wary of every corner. Even though I try and anticipate these things, they get me every time.

Even the title screen makes me feel uncomfortable and edgy.

Would I suggest any improvements? Only one. It would be nice to see a few more types of environment. The lack of visual variety can grow a little stale and I would imagine it would be as easy as adding new textures onto the walls.

Would I recommend Dreadhalls? If you have a heart condition, absolutely not. To everyone else? Absolutely. Just be prepared to have a change of trousers nearby.
